Synthetic Data Blueprint (SDB): A modular framework for the statistical, structural, and graph-based evaluation of synthetic tabular data

Tech 5 min read

The article introduces the Synthetic Data Blueprint (SDB), a comprehensive framework designed to evaluate synthetic tabular data through statistical, structural, and graph-based assessments. SDB is modular, allowing users to customize the evaluation process to fit specific needs and data types. It aims to provide a standardized approach to assess the quality and utility of synthetic data generated for various applications, ensuring that it accurately mimics real-world data in critical aspects. The authors highlight the significance of SDB in advancing the field of synthetic data

Read full article

AgREE: Agentic Reasoning for Knowledge Graph Completion on Emerging Entities

Tech 5 min read

The article "AgREE: Agentic Reasoning for Knowledge Graph Completion on Emerging Entities" discusses a novel framework designed to enhance knowledge graph completion for emerging entities that lack sufficient historical data. The proposed model, AgREE, adopts an agentic reasoning approach, employing a combination of machine learning techniques and dynamic knowledge inference to predict missing links effectively. By leveraging agentic intelligence, AgREE is able to dynamically adapt to new information and make informed predictions even in cases where entities are newly introduced and sparsely connected
